projects.name: Utilising Chromoprotein Expression to Counteract Coral Bleaching
projects.summary: To address coral bleaching problems, the project aims to design a genetic circuit conditionally expressing chromoprotein regulated by heat and light intensity, mimicsing the protective effects of turbid waters and thereby reduces the damages caused by high temperature and high light intensity to corals.  As one of the main wet lab contributor, I spearheaded the design of a key circuit part and conducted intensive wet lab experiments. I was responsible for the end-to-end experimental process, from designing protocols and executing complex assays to maintaining comprehensive documentation.
